ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Question about crafted weapons
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Ninev, I noticed the fier dal weapons use regular mithril sheets.  Is this true even for the Imbued Weapons?  What skill does one need to have a reasonable
ygData.messageBody:
Hey Ninev, I noticed the fier'dal weapons use regular mithril sheets. Is
this true even for the Imbued Weapons? What skill does one need to have a
reasonable success rate on them?

I have a ranger friend on E'ci who'd love to have a Tunare Rapier, what are
you selling them for?

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Ioshua [mailto:Ioshua@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 17, 2000 11:19 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Question about crafted weapons


Who knows? There seems to be little to base a guess on. The Fier'Dal
series are all races but the Koda'Dal are elf only and the Tier'Dal are
Inkie/Human/Half/Troll. I'd think that the halfling weapons might be
usable by up to at least elves to throw the halflings a marketable bone
but I'm not too sure because the Dwarven weapons are limited to
stubbies alone. I do hope they implement bristlebane imbued Fier'Dal
gear. I have druids and clerics waiting in line for Tunare and Karana
morningstars and a pile of people asking "Can you make those rapiers in
Bristlebane?" that I have to turn away. I think this new smithing is
great, I just wish there were more gem options. Who knows, Yak said
there would be more recipies added so there may just be some coming
down the pipe yet. As far as Bristlebane, if no Fier'Dal flavors
arrive, I'd look to the Gnomes before the Halflings.

Also, as a point of clarity for those who don't know, you don't have to
worship the deity to make the weapons, just to imbue the gems and use
the gear.

Ninev Rudeflute
Also E'ci


--- "Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)" <g4mntofcr@...>
wrote:
> Wood elven blacksmiths can craft Mithril Fier'dal weapons. These
> items are deity items linked to Tunare. My bard is a wood elf but I
> chose Bristlebane since I figured the god of rogues was more fitting
> for a bard than Tunare.
> So does that mean I can not equip these weapons since I don't worship
> Tunare? And if I can't equip weapons crafted by wood elves, could I
> equip deity weapons crafted by halflings who worship Bristlebane?
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
>
